text: Which of the following statement is/are true for functions f, g and h? [Assume all the functions are defined from R* - RY] () If f (n) = O (g (n)) and g (n) = O(h(n)) then h (n) = O(f (n)). (b)If f (n) = O (g (n)) and g (n) = O(h(n)) then { (n) = O(h (n)). (c) If f (n) = O (g (n)) and g (n) = w(h(n)) then h(n) can be O (f (n)). (d)Iff (n) = O (f (n) + g(n)) then g (n) = O (f(n)).
